title: Russia reiterates commitment to uncompromising fight with India against terrorism
content: The statement came after the all-party parliamentary delegation arrived late to Moscow, due to Ukrainian drone attacks, in a diplomatic bid to reiterate the Indian position on terrorism.

title: 71% Indians experienced severe heatwave in last 12 months: study
content: The Yale Program on Climate Change Communication and CVoter surveyed 10,751 Indians and found that most of them had personally experienced at least one extreme weather event in the past 12 months.

title: Zero tolerance for terrorism, India will never give in to nuclear blackmail: Jaishankar in Germany
content: The German foreign minister publicly condemned the terrorist attack on India, and supported India's right to defend itself against terrorism

title: Low sodium salt substitutes yet to take off in city
content: Low sodium salt substitutes are alternatives to regular table salt which is high in sodium content; the survey says that 52% of supermarkets and hypermarkets stock the substitutes, whereas only 4% of local grocery shops have them

title: Ceasefire with India is holding, we are fully committed to it: Pakistan Foreign Office
content: Shafqat Ali Khan also said that the two militaries have a channel of communication through the Directors General of Military Operations, through which they are working for de-escalation

title: Kerala woman’s journey to the peak of Mount Everest
content: She scaled the 8,849-foot-high peak on May 18. As part of the training, she climbed Mt Kilimanjaro in Tanzania,  Mt Aconcagua in Argentina, Mt Elbrus in Russia along with her husband.

title: TG and A.P. resolve to strengthen inter-state cooperation in civil supplies sector
content: Telangana would gain critical infrastructure such as corporation flats and storage facilities, while Andhra would facilitate rice exports through Kakinada Port, opening up international markets including the Philippines

title: Caste census a ‘moral obligation’ of Indian democracy: Kharge
content: Congress chief urges party spokespersons to take the message of social justice to the grassroots in view of the upcoming caste census; need to make data public and then rebuild policies, he says

title: Naidu requests Centre to set up defence projects in Andhra Pradesh
content: Andhra Pradesh has proposed a missile and ammunition production centre in Jaggayyapeta–Dolakonda cluster, a centre for military and civil aircraft and electronics manufacturing in Lepakshi–Madakasira cluster, says the Chief Minister

title: Removed from ration card without consent, woman finally wins battle
content: The names of the woman and her children were removed from the ration card upon her husband’s request to transfer the ownership of the card to him

title: Supreme Court rules that CAPF officers to be ‘organised services’ for all purposes
content: The top court orders for IPS deputation to CAPFs in senior ranks to be reduced progressively within two years

title: Lepakshi and APCO sign MoU to improve market visibility of  handloom and handicraft products
content: The collaboration outlines measures such as consignment-based exchanges, allocation of showroom space for displays and implementation of strategic logistics and pricing measures

title: The Hindu’s campaigns receive prestigious INMA Global Media Awards
content: Campaign marking city’s anniversary secured two first places, two second places, and a third; The Hindu also shared a top global win, while The Hindu Young World initiative was lauded.

title: Progress report indicates Kerala government’s resolve to go ahead with SilverLine project
content: Report states the government’s intention to launch the land acquisition process for the ₹60,000-crore project after environmental impact studies and securing the necessary clearances

title: Young Lieutenant Shashank Tiwari dies saving fellow soldier in Sikkim
content: Army officials said that the officer was leading a Route Opening Patrol towards a Tactical Operating Base in Sikkim — a key post being prepared for future deployment

title: 4 Maoists with ₹18 lakh bounty killed in Maharashtra’s Gadchiroli
content: The encounter took place along the Maharastra-Chhattisgarh border barely 25 km from the site where 27 Maoists were killed in an encounter two days ago; in another encounter in Sukma district, a Maoist operative was killed by the security forces

title: India extends airspace ban for Pakistan airlines till June 23
content: The ban set up in the wake of the Pahalgam attack was set to expire on May 23; Pakistan has also extended the ban on its airspace for Indian flights by a month till June 24

title: Shelling in J&K not random, Pakistan picked its targets: Trinamool
content: Five-member TMC delegation concluded their two-day visit to J&K, with the Rajya Sabha TMC leader Derek O’Brien asserting that the Pakistani strikes were not random but aimed at specific civilian areas.

title: Delhi court issues notice to Nirmala Sitharaman in defamation case by Somnath Bharti’s wife
content: The complainant had alleged that, during the Lok Sabha polls in 2024, the Minister had published defamatory, derogatory and libellous remarks in print and electronic media against her and the same were broadcasted in two TV channels

title: Yoga events to be held at tourist spots in NTR district to spread awareness
content: 2,500 yoga masters will hold sessions at village, mandal and division levels every day up to June 21, says Collector

title: Pangkang villagers sign MoU for Siang upper project amid local dissent
content: State hails pact as milestone in cooperative development; ₹5 crore package announced for project-affected families

title: BMTC to introduce new NICE road route from Tavarekere to Electronics City
content: The new route will connect Tavarekere to Electronic City via Kadabagere Cross, Gollarahatti, and the NICE Road, catering especially to daily office-goers and industrial area employees.

title: Ujjain police questions vlogger Jyoti Rani over Mahakaleshwar visit
content: Visit to temple city under scrutiny following arrest on espionage charges; nothing suspicious found, say officials

title: No more ‘Pak’ in Mysore Pak: Jaipur shops rename sweets to reflect ‘popular sentiments’
content: From Mysore Pak to Swarna Bhasma Pak, many popular sweets get a new name, thanks to local people claiming the term ‘Pak’ reminded them of Pakistan

title: Officials at fault for flooding in Bengaluru, say Karnataka Lokayukta
content: A committee led by BBMP Commissioner M. Maheshwar Rao has been formed to come up with ‘a holistic solution’

title: Madras High Court holds former Coimbatore Collector, DRO and  RDO guilty of contempt
content: Justice P. Velmurugan directs them to pay a fine of ₹10,000 each from their salaries besides sentencing four Tahsildars and one VAO to one month simple imprisonment

title: Election Commission to provide mobile phone deposit facilities for voters outside polling stations
content: The mobile phones shall be allowed within 100 meters of the polling station, and that too in switched-off mode. No mobile phones shall be allowed to be carried inside the polling station by the voter, the the poll panel said in a statement.

title: HC orders action under Wildlife Protection Act against people dumping, burning waste at Sabarimala
content: Directive follows death of two elephants and a deer after consuming plastic waste dumped on the temple premises

title: Six killed, two kids critically injured in car-truck collision in Prakasam district
content: Four of the deceased belonged to one family, the accident took place near Taticharla Motu in Komarolu mandal of Prakasam district when the victims were returning from Mahanandi

title: Covid-surveillance to be strengthened in Kerala
content: State reports 273 cases of covid so far in May this year, with Kottayam reporting 82 cases, Thiruvananthapuram (73), Ernakulam (49), Pathanamthitta (30) and Thrissur (26) cases

title: Curtains come down on LDF government’s fourth anniversary celebrations
content: He says Kerala will continue to support NH development. The issues detected on some NH sections should not be seen as affecting the entire stretch.

title: Shahi Masjid in Public Gardens to host a mediation centre
content: The Ifadah Community Mediation Centre will follow all rules and regulations and  would not function as a Darul Qaza, Shahi Masjid Khateeb Maulana Ahsan bin Mohammed al-Hamoomi said

title: Delhi reports 23 COVID-19 cases, issues advisory to hospitals
content: Delhi Health Minister confirms 23 COVID-19 cases, assures preparedness and coordination with hospitals for rapid response and care

title: 104-year-old life convict released from Uttar Pradesh’s district jail after 43 years
content: Lakhan was involved in the death of a man named Prabhu Saroj, who was killed during a fight between two groups on August 16, 1977

title: Collapse of NH 66 stretches in Kerala: NHAI admits to lapses before HC
content: Court directs the NHAI to file a report by May 29, specifically mentioning cause for collapse of NH 66 stretches and rectification measures that the agency proposes to carry out

title: Madurai police grapple with shortage of Inspectors
content: 17 Inspectors take care of 40 law and order police stations and nine manage more than two police stations, according to sourcees

title: 125 kg of ganja seized in Thrissur, four arrested
content: Ganja was being smuggled from Odisha to central Kerala in a lorry. Thrissur Rural police make seizure under Operation D-Hunt and part of the 2025–2026 School Safety Campaign

title: Delhi HC reserves order on Celebi’s plea against revocation of security clearance
content: The Turkiye-based firm argued that the Centre’s decision, without any warning or notice, was against the principles of natural justice and in violation of the Aircraft Security Rules

title: Lack of quorum puts Mayor in a spot at Corporation Council meeting; AIADMK objects to passing of resolutions
content: CPI(M) member says work seems to be happening only in a select or few wards and urges the Mayor to allocate funds for all wards equally to prevent lopsided development of the city

title: Forest Department to pilot the use of drones and unmanned vehicles for fire management
content: The trial is aimed at assessing the effectiveness of these advanced machines in detecting and controlling wildfires. Based on the results of the pilot, a phased roll-out is planned across other vulnerable forest regions of Tamil Nadu

title: Anna University to ‘restructure’ PG courses with poor student patronage
content: Consultations with various departments and stakeholders are under way. After a consensus is arrived upon, the university will submit a proposal before the Convenor Committee for approval

title: ED likely to summon Parameshwara in gold smuggling case
content: Union Ministers Pralhad Joshi and H.D. Kumaraswamy claim the ED raid was a fallout of the Congress’ internal strife

title: Two arrested for impersonation, assault and extortion in Attapur
content: They duo initially demanded ₹60,000. When Abdul resisted, they reduced the demand, first to ₹8,000, then to ₹3,000. When he did not budge, they assaulted him

title: Domestic violence: public hearing in Thiruvananthapuram on Saturday
content: Discussion on limitation of the government-legal machinery and the need for social change will be held

title: DGP reviews implementation of new criminal laws in Telangana
content: As of May 22, Telangana Police had registered 1,37,644 cases under the new BNS, along with 1,251 Zero FIRs.

title: Community Health Officers strike in AP enters 25th day
content: Nearly 10,000 Community Health Officers in the State have not received 23% enhancement on par with other NHM employees, and regularisation of services is also pending for those who completed six years of service, says APMCA president

title: Skill development in emerging technologies, TGCHE and NASSCOM ink MoU
content: One lakh learners to be upskilled annually over the next three years; collaboration to offer micro-learning content, foundation and deep-skilling courses (both free and paid), and a specialised offline course in ‘embedded software development and testing’ to build critical digital capability

title: Killing of Maoist leaders in Chhattisgarh encounter illegal, says Porattom
content: According to them, the killing of Basavaraju in Chhattisgarh had taken place well after the CPI(Maoist) had unilaterally declared a ceasefire to pave the way for peace talks with the Union govt.

title: 'I'm going to get back at y'all': Inside Tyrese Haliburton's historic playoff run
content: From 26 minutes in France to a slow start to the 2024-25 season, the Pacers' star has found motivation from the outside.

title: Cora empathizes with Hendriks over threats
content: One day after Red Sox reliever Liam Hendriks took to social media to condemn offensive messages made against him and his family, manager Alex Cora empathized with his player.

title: Napoli edges out Inter to win 4th Serie A title
content: Napoli clinched their second Serie A title in three seasons after edging out Inter Milan thanks to a 2-0 home victory over Cagliari in a dramatic finale to the season on Friday.

title: Green Bay files NCAA waiver to play in $1M TBT
content: Green Bay has filed for a waiver from the NCAA to allow its men's basketball team to compete in The Basketball Tournament, the $1 million, winner-take-all summer tournament.

title: USC DB commit Sermons reclassifies to '25 class
content: Four-star USC cornerback pledge R.J. Sermons, ESPN's No. 28 overall prospect in the 2026 cycle, has reclassified into the 2025 cycle and will join the Trojans program this summer.

title: Guardians' Lively to have Tommy John surgery
content: Guardians pitcher Ben Lively will undergo Tommy John reconstruction surgery on his right elbow and will miss the rest of the season, the team announced Friday.

title: Touted Wilkins picks Duke, reclassifies to 2025
content: Top-25 recruit Sebastian Wilkins has committed to Duke and will reclassify into the 2025 class, adding to the Blue Devils' top-ranked recruiting class.

title: Newgarden the fastest in final Indy 500 practice
content: Two-time defending Indy 500 champion Josef Newgarden put together the fastest lap on the final day of practice for the Indianapolis 500, while others such as Takuma Soto and Graham Rahal struggled.

title: Djokovic one win from 100th career singles title
content: Novak Djokovic is one win from a 100th career singles title on the ATP Tour after advancing to the final at the Geneva Open.

title: 🏈 Connelly's CFP seeding change takeaways
content: A new CFP seeding rule would have altered last year's matchups and will have consequences moving forward.

title: How Oilers coach Kris Knoblauch became master of the midseries adjustment
content: With Edmonton down 1-0, its bench boss inspires calmness instead of panic based on past performances.

title: Best surprises, worst surprises and no surprises: Takeaways from Week 1 of the WNBA
content: The Mercury's depth is better than expected, and shooting from the Sky and Valkyries has underwhelmed.

title: Is Betts poised to pass Trout as best player of their generation? Let's find out
content: Mookie Betts is climbing the all-time WAR list the same way Mike Trout once was. We examine the two and dive into which players similarly ruled previous eras.

title: Picking the NFL’s most underrated players: 12 names -- one at every position -- deserving of more respect
content: Who are the most underappreciated players in the NFL? We picked one at 12 different positions, including a veteran tight end.

title: Which NBA Finals matchup is most compelling? We're ranking all four possible series
content: No matter which two teams escape the conference finals, we're headed for a never-before-seen Finals matchup.

title: Ancelotti after Madrid exit sealed: Bond is 'eternal'
content: Carlo Ancelotti will leave Real Madrid after this weekend's final game of the LaLiga season, the club has confirmed.

title: Sources: Garnacho set for Man Utd transfer talks
content: Alejandro Garnacho is increasingly likely to leave Manchester United this summer, sources have told ESPN.

title: NWSL's DeMelo reveals she has hyperthyroidism
content: Savannah DeMelo was diagnosed with Graves' disease and hyperthyroidism last fall, conditions she spoke about publicly for the first time this week with ESPN.

title: Ronaldo sells stake in Valladolid following protests
content: Brazil great Ronaldo is selling his controlling stake in Valladolid, the Spanish soccer club said on Friday.

title: Masche: Messi renewal would bring 'tranquility'
content: Inter Miami head coach Javier Mascherano emphasized his desire to captain Lionel Messi to renew his contract with the club.

title: Source: Boston agrees deal with Benfica's Patão
content: Benfica women's coach Filipa Patão has agreed to terms with Boston Legacy FC to become the NWSL club's first head coach, a source told ESPN.

title: The case for and against Man United keeping Ruben Amorim as manager
content: The pressure continues to build on Man United boss Ruben Amorim and whether he'll remain as manager following a Europa League final loss. So let's make the arguments for keeping him or making a clean break.

title: The 12 most impactful NBA draft withdrawal decisions for college basketball
content: Milos Uzan, Alex Condon and other college hoops stars whose NBA draft decisions could materially shape 2025-26.

title: Will Penske cheating scandal overshadow IndyCar's crown jewel?
content: Instead of celebrating a sellout crowd, IndyCar is defusing another cheating scandal ahead of the Indy 500.

title: Norris finds peace, not pressure, in F1 title expectations
content: While the weight of expectation to win F1's title can crush some, Lando Norris is using it as motivation.

title: Everything you need to bet Monaco, Indy 500 and Coca-Cola 600
content: Betting guide to the biggest weekend in motorsports, with the Monaco Grand Prix, Indy 500, and Coca-Cola 600.

title: Two pro football seasons in one year? The 'unheard of' pursuit of some NFL hopefuls
content: NFL dreams have come true for UFL players, but it can come with the price of the longest season of a player's life.

title: Experts weigh in: How will Djokovic and Swiatek fare? Can Alcaraz defend?
content: Alcaraz and Swiatek were last year's French Open champs, but Sinner, Gauff and many more could contend.

title: Best homecoming? Most likely to leave the team chat? Tennessee and UCLA's 'QB swap' lead portal superlatives
content: We awarded superlatives for a spring college football transfer portal window that saw Tennessee and UCLA swap quarterbacks, among other intriguing moves.

title: Roundtable: Best fight on the schedule? Next P4P king? Potential upset?
content: Andreas Hale and Nick Parkinson share their thoughts on the fights they want to see, a potential upset and more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal make first move for €80m Real Madrid star Rodrygo
content: Arsenal have held the first exploratory discussions to sign Rodrygo from Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Kiki Iriafen trending up, Dominique Malonga falling
content: Kiki Iriafen has made an impact in her first week in the WNBA, while Dominique Malonga has struggled to stay on the court in this week's fantasy risers and fallers.

title: Colonel Assault Case: Punjab Police Inspector's Anticipatory Bail Rejected
content: The Punjab and Haryana High Court on Friday rejected the anticipatory bail plea of Punjab Police inspector Ronnie Singh Salh in connection with the assault case of Army Colonel Pushpinder Singh Bath in Patiala more than two months ago.

title: US Congressman Ro Khanna Condemns Trump's Harvard Foreign Students Ban
content: Following the Donald Trump administration's decision to bar Harvard University from enrolling international students, US Congressman Ro Khanna criticised the move and challenged prominent tech figures including Elon Musk to defend the ban.

title: 39-Year-Old Woman Arrested After Knife Attack In Germany's Hamburg
content: Germany police on Friday said they had arrested a woman after at least 12 people were injured in a knife attack at the main station in the northern city of Hamburg.

title: 12 Injured In Knife Attack At Railway Station In Germany's Hamburg
content: At least 12 people were injured in a knife attack in Hamburg station on Friday evening, Germany's Bild newspaper reported, and local police confirmed they had arrested the suspected assailant.

title: 'KCR Is God, Surrounded By Some Devils': K Kavitha On Letter Leak
content: The internal differences within the Bharat Rashtra Samithi came to the fore on Friday with party MLC K Kavitha taking exception to the letter she wrote to her father and party president K Chandrasekhar Rao (KCR) getting leaked.

title: Israeli Settlers Thrashed Palestinians, Torched Cars, Houses In West Bank
content: The Israeli military said it had received a report on Thursday that Israeli civilians had vandalised property in the area of the village, in the northern part of the West Bank.

title: Trump Signs Order To Boost US Nuclear Energy
content: President Donald Trump signed a series of executive orders Friday to boost nuclear energy in the United States, including by rolling back regulatory processes on a still divisive technology.

title: India Records 257 Covid Cases Amid Surge, 23 In Capital
content: India is currently witnessing a modest rise in Covid-19 infections, with the Union Health Ministry reporting 257 active cases so far. Kerala, Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu account for over 85 per cent of these cases.

title: Oracle To Buy $40 Billion Of Nvidia Chips For OpenAI's US Data Center
content: Oracle will spend around $40 billion on Nvidia's higher-performance chips to power OpenAI's new US data center, the Financial Times reported on Friday.

title: Explained: The New US-Backed Gaza Aid Plan And Why UN Does Not Like It
content: A US-backed organization aims to start work in the Gaza Strip by the end of May, overseeing a new model of aid distribution in the Palestinian enclave, but the United Nations says the plan is not impartial or neutral, and it will not be involved.

title: UK Net Migration Falls To Half In 2024, Compared To Previous Year
content: The decline in net migration has been welcomed by the Home Secretary, Yvette Cooper, who stated that "the 300,000 drop in net migration since the election is important and welcome after the figures quadrupled to nearly a million last parliament."

title: 'Selfish' Genes "Introners" Proves To Be Major Source Of Genetic Complexity: Study
content: A new study proves that a type of genetic element called 'introners' is the mechanism by which many introns spread within and between species.

title: JD Vance Says Use Of Military Force Under Trump Will Be "Cautious, Decisive"
content: US Vice President JD Vance said on Friday that the United States under President Donald Trump will choose carefully when to use military force and will avoid involvement in open-ended conflicts in what he called a break from recent US policies.

title: "People Are Fantasising": Russia Brushes Aside Vatican-Mediated Ukraine Peace Talks
content: Moscow has played down the idea of the Vatican being a potential location for peace talks between Russia and Ukraine, calling it a "fantasy" that many people are talking about.

title: "In The Nuclear Era....:" What UK Analyst Said On Operation Sindoor
content: The recent military action between India and Pakistan was the first instance of two nuclear weapon states engaging in continuous strikes and counter-strikes, which sparked global tensions, Dr Walter Ladwig, a professor at King's College London, said.

title: Experienced Decades Of Pak-Sponsored Terror Attacks: India At UN
content: India on Friday slammed Pakistan at the UN Security Council, saying it has experienced decades of Pakistani sponsored terrorist attacks ranging from the 26/11 Mumbai attacks to "barbaric mass murder" of innocent tourists in Pahalgam last month.

title: "Dehumanising": Students Caught In Harvard Crisis Speak To Foreign Media
content: There are 6,800 international students in Harvard that make up about 27% of Harvards enrollments this year. About one-third of its foreign students are Chinese and 700 are Indian.

title: Army Officer, 23, Dies Rescuing Soldier, Had Joined Force 6 Months Ago
content: An Indian Army officer jumped into a stream in Sikkim to save a fellow soldier, eventually drowning himself after being swept away by the current.

title: 'Important, Optimistic It'll Be Functional Soon': Union Minister On Sikkim Airport
content: Taking a keen interest in the airport at Pakyong, which serves Sikkim's capital Gangtok and has seen no flight operations for nearly two years, Union Minister Pabitra Margherita said he is optimistic that it will be functional again soon.

title: On Bail, Karnataka Gangrape Accused Celebrate On Streets, Get Arrested Again
content: The police on Friday arrested four of the seven prime accused in a gang rape case -- who were out on bail -- for parading the streets of Akki Allur here in cars, celebrating the release.

title: D.K. Shivakumar, Zameer Ahmed discuss Bengaluru city projects with Manohar Lal Khattar
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The Hindu On Books Books of the week .

title: Hitting where it hurts: India targets Pak's terror funding, to approach World Bank & FATF
content: India is intensifying its efforts to financially isolate Pakistan, contesting World Bank loans and urging the FATF to reinstate it on the grey list. This follows India's opposition to the IMF bailout, citing concerns about Pakistan's economic history and potential misuse of funds for terrorism.

title: ‘No one undermined democracy in Pak like this’: EAM on hypocrisy of West
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has criticised the West for its support of military regimes in Pakistan, asserting that this backing has significantly undermined democracy in the country. He highlighted Europe's focus on its own energy needs, questioning the expectation that other nations should suffer due to Europe's actions regarding Russian oil.

title: Failed Schengen visas: Indians lost Rs 136 cr with over 1.65L applications rejected in 2024
content: In 2024, over 1.65 lakh Indian Schengen visa applications were denied, costing applicants nearly Rs 136 crore in non-refundable fees. India ranks third globally in visa rejection costs, with a rejection rate of nearly 15% out of 11.08 lakh applications. This has raised concerns about transparency and impacts tourism and business travel.

title: Microsoft software engineer fired for disrupting CEO's speech at Build 2025
content: Microsoft fired a software engineer, Joe Lopez, for disrupting CEO Satya Nadella's keynote at Build 2025, protesting the company's partnership with the Israeli military. Lopez accused Microsoft of complicity in harming Palestinians through its Azure cloud services.

title: 'Everything changed for Musk when Trump denied Tesla CEO access to...': MAGA man Bannon
content: Following a New York Times report in March 2025 about a potential Pentagon briefing on the U.S.-China conflict, Donald Trump denied Elon Musk's involvement, leading Musk to distance himself from the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). Musk shifted his focus back to Tesla, SpaceX, and Twitter, reducing his political donations.

title: Sikkim: Army officer dies rescuing fellow soldier from mountain stream
content: Lieutenant Shashank Tiwari of the Sikkim Scouts tragically died in North Sikkim while rescuing a fellow soldier, Agniveer Stephan Subba, from a dangerous mountain stream. Despite successfully saving Subba with the help of Naik Pukar Katel, Lt. Tiwari was swept away by the strong current. "His sacrifice has been hailed nationwide. He stands as a symbol of courage and selflessness,” the defence statement said.

title: 'Save your lives first': When Pak commander abandoned post during Op Sindoor
content: Operation Sindoor, launched by the Indian Army following the Pahalgam terror attack, successfully dismantled terror infrastructure across the LoC. Intercepted communications revealed panic within the Pakistan army, with a senior commander from the 75th Infantry Brigade abandoning his post and seeking refuge in a mosque. Pakistani retaliation involved shelling civilian areas, prompting further strikes on Pakistani military posts.

title: Indian-American software engineer who 'shamed' Microsoft CEOs at co's 50th anniversary celebrations, disrupts event again
content: Indian-American engineer Vaniya Agrawal, previously known for disrupting Microsoft's 50th anniversary, recently protested at the Build 2025 developer event. Agrawal, along with ex-Microsoft employee Hossam Nasr, confronted Microsoft's AI security head, Neta Haiby, over the company's contracts with Israel.

title: IPL 2025: Ishan Kishan and Pat Cummins dent RCB's top-two hopes
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad defeated Royal Challengers Bengaluru by 42 runs, propelled by Ishan Kishan's explosive 94 and valuable contributions from Heinrich Klaasen and Aniket Verman, setting a formidable target of 231. Despite Virat Kohli and Phil Salt's efforts, RCB's batting lineup collapsed after their dismissals, leading to a significant drop in their net run rate.

title: Describing any court as ‘lower courts’ undermines constitutional ethos, says SC
content: The Supreme Court has once again emphasized that trial courts should not be called 'lower courts,' as this terminology contradicts the principles of the Constitution. This directive was reiterated while acquitting two life convicts in a 1981 murder case.

title: Telangana gig workers' union flags 'low wages, exploitation' at Zepto in letter to labour dept; Zepto reacts
content: The Telangana Gig and Platform Workers' Union has accused Zepto of exploitative labor practices, including low per-delivery rates and unsafe working conditions, prompting a strike in Hyderabad. Zepto denies the allegations, asserting that delivery partners earn competitive hourly wages and receive comprehensive welfare benefits, including insurance and access to facilities at dark stores.

title: Harvard row: Federal judge halts Trump's ban on int'l students
content: A federal judge temporarily blocked the Trump administration's ban on Harvard University enrolling international students, following a lawsuit challenging the government's decision. Harvard argued the ban was retaliation for refusing to comply with politically motivated demands. The university highlighted the confusion caused by the ban, affecting thousands of international students and academic programs.

title: 'SC heavily CJI-centric': Justice Oka says court's 'image must change'
content: In his farewell address, Justice Abhay S Oka critiqued the Supreme Court's 'Chief Justice-centric' administration, advocating for a more democratic approach and greater use of technology in case listing. He also highlighted the urgent need to address the massive backlog of cases in the apex court and the neglect of trial courts, emphasizing joint efforts from the bar and bench.

title: Tharoor's swipe at Trump over ceasefire claim: 'Is that called mediation?'
content: Shashi Tharoor refuted Donald Trump's claim of mediating between India and Pakistan, clarifying that no formal mediation was requested or conducted. He emphasized that while India maintains contact with concerned nations during crises, it doesn't constitute mediation. An all-party delegation, led by Tharoor, will visit the US to explain India's counter-terrorism approach and Operation Sindoor, launched after a terror attack.

title: Why Bangladesh interim chief Yunus is threatening to resign
content: Muhammad Yunus, the interim head of Bangladesh, is reportedly considering resigning due to political deadlock and pressure from various factions. He faces criticism for delaying elections, a warning from the army chief, and accusations of undermining freedoms from Human Rights Watch. According to reports, Yunus said in the meeting with his advisers, "what is the point of being the chief advisor if he cannot function properly?”

title: 'It was so unreal': Man wakes to find cargo ship with 16 crew in his garden
content: A Norwegian man in Byneset awoke to find a 135-meter container ship, the NCL Salten, grounded in his front yard after it veered off course in the Trondheim fjord. The ship, carrying sixteen crew members, narrowly missed his house, prompting a police investigation into the cause, focusing on potential human error or mechanical failure.

title: Sunrisers Hyderabad create IPL record against Royal Challengers Bengaluru
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad's score of 231 against Royal Challengers Bengaluru marked the 42nd instance of a 200-plus total in the current IPL season, surpassing the previous record of 41 set last year. Gujarat Titans currently leads with seven such scores, followed by Punjab Kings with six.

title: 'They killed peace activists': A love story cut down by hate outside a DC Museum
content: Yaron Lischinsky and Sarah Milgrim, dedicated to peace and interfaith dialogue, were tragically murdered outside the Capital Jewish Museum in Washington, D.C. The suspect, Elias Rodriguez, allegedly shouted "Free Palestine!" during the attack, highlighting the escalating tensions and antisemitism. Their deaths underscore the human cost of global conflict and the urgent need for tolerance and understanding.

title: Apple shares tumble 4% as Trump threatens 25% tariff on iPhones made outside US
content: Apple's stock price tumbled after Donald Trump threatened a 25% tariff on iPhones made outside the US, escalating trade tensions. The announcement, made on Truth Social, triggered a Wall Street sell-off, with major tech stocks also declining. Trump also proposed a 50% tariff on EU goods, further unsettling investors amid ongoing trade negotiations and uncertainty surrounding US demands.

title: 'A water bomb': Pak Senator reveals impact of India suspending Indus pact
content: Pakistani Senator Syed Ali Zafar has urged the government to address the potential water crisis arising from India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty after the Pahalgam attack. He warned of dire consequences for Pakistan's agriculture and population, heavily reliant on the Indus Basin water. India's decision to hold the treaty in abeyance is a response to cross-border terrorism.

title: 'There should be no confusion': EAM's message to US on India, Pak ties
content: During his visit to Germany, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar firmly stated that India will not yield to nuclear threats from Pakistan and will only engage bilaterally. This declaration follows India's response to the Pahalgam terror attack with Operation Sindoor, emphasizing India's zero tolerance for terrorism.

title: 'After Pak denied airspace, IAF assisted Indigo jet in landing at Srinagar'
content: Indian Air Force sources reported that Lahore air traffic control denied IndiGo's Delhi-Srinagar flight permission to use Pakistani airspace on May 21 due to an existing airspace ban for Indian-registered aircraft. The flight, encountering a hailstorm near Pathankot, was initially denied deviation towards the International Border by Indian authorities.

title: DK Shivakumar admits Rs 25 lakh National Herald donation; says 'nothing to conceal' amid ED probe
content: Karnataka's Deputy CM, DK Shivakumar, openly admitted to donating Rs 25 lakh to the National Herald, a newspaper he identifies as being run by his party. This admission follows the ED naming his brother and Telangana CM Revanth Reddy in its chargesheet related to the case. Meanwhile, BRS working president KTR accused the Telangana CM of corruption.

title: Relief for Indian students? Harvard sues Trump admin over foreign students' ban
content: Harvard University is suing the Trump administration over a decision to bar foreign students, alleging it's unconstitutional retaliation for resisting political pressure. The lawsuit challenges the directive, claiming it violates the First Amendment and harms over 7,000 international students. Harvard seeks a restraining order against the Department of Homeland Security's enforcement of the policy.

title: Amid uptick in Covid cases, Delhi govt issues advisory
content: The Delhi government has issued a Covid advisory, urging hospitals to prepare for a potential surge. This action follows a rise in cases across multiple states in India and a resurgence in parts of Asia. While cases remain mild, experts advise precautions like mask-wearing and vaccination, especially for vulnerable populations, due to waning immunity and new sub-variants.

title: India & Pak extend closure of airspace for each other's airlines by a month
content: Pakistan has prolonged its airspace closure for Indian airlines until June 24, 2025, impacting flights to and from the west. This extension, detailed in a new notice, restricts access for Indian-registered aircraft, including military flights. While many foreign airlines now overfly Pakistan, Indian carriers from North India face longer routes due to the ongoing restrictions.

title: IPL 2025: Why is Patidar not playing in RCB vs SRH? Who is the captain?
content: In a surprising turn, Jitesh Sharma is leading Royal Challengers Bengaluru against Sunrisers Hyderabad, replacing Rajat Patidar who was named as Impact Player. RCB, aiming for a top-two finish, won the toss and elected to field, bringing in Mayank Agarwal for Devdutt Padikkal. Sunrisers Hyderabad, already eliminated, included Travis Head, Abhinav Manohar, and Jaydev Unadkat in their lineup.

title: How Jyoti Malhotra became ISI agent Danish's first catch in spy hunt
content: An expelled Pakistan High Commission staffer, identified as an ISI officer, attempted to recruit Indian nationals by targeting visa applicants and their relatives. He aimed to gather sensitive information and promote pro-Pakistan narratives online. This incident follows a pattern of Pakistani intelligence operatives using the high commission for espionage, leading to previous expulsions and staff reductions.

title: Trump intensifies trade war with threats of 50% tariff on EU, 25% penalty on Apple
content: Donald Trump has warned Apple about tariffs. He says a 25% tariff will be imposed if iPhones are made outside America. Trump claims he told Tim Cook that iPhones for the US market should be manufactured in the United States not in "India or anyplace else." The remarks come at a time when Apple is aggressively expanding its manufacturing footprint in India.

title: 'Vajpayee didn't ...': Harivansh counters Rahul Gandhi's Op Sindoor remarks
content: Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh rebuked Rahul Gandhi for questioning the government and armed forces regarding Operation Sindoor, referencing Atal Bihari Vajpayee's conduct during the 1971 war. He highlighted instances of alleged UPA government missteps, including concealing news of soldier beheadings.

title: 'Tough life': SC asks IAF not to release woman officer who served in Op Sindoor
content: The Supreme Court intervened in the case of Wing Commander Nikita Pandey, directing the government and IAF to halt her release from service. Pandey alleged discrimination in being denied permanent commission despite her exemplary service in Operations Balakot and Sindoor. She claimed that although she ranked second in the country among expert fighter controllers and had served over 13.5 years, she was being discharged due to a 2019 policy change that denied her a permanent commission.

title: 'Talks going nowhere': Trump calls for 50% tariff on EU from June 1
content: Donald Trump plans a 50% tariff on the European Union starting June 1, 2025. He says trade talks are stalled. Trump claims the EU takes advantage of the US. He also warns Apple. Trump wants iPhones sold in America to be made in America. He says tariffs will apply if Apple manufactures elsewhere.

title: BJP, Congress locked in war of words after Rahul's Op Sindoor remarks
content: Rahul Gandhi's criticism of India's foreign policy under Modi sparked a political row, questioning India's global standing post Operation Sindoor. BJP retaliated, accusing Gandhi of undermining the nation and armed forces. The MEA refuted Gandhi's claim about warning Pakistan before the operation, clarifying it was during the early phase. Operation Sindoor was launched in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Dual taxation on broadcasting services permissible in law: Supreme Court judgment

title: FAA clears SpaceX Starship's Flight 9 after Flight 8 explosion review
content: SpaceX has received FAA approval for the ninth Starship launch after addressing issues from Flight 8's explosion. The upcoming launch includes an expanded Aircraft Hazard Area and requires non-peak transit hours. A key goal is reusing the Super Heavy booster from Flight 7, demonstrating crucial reusability for future space missions, with a potential launch window opening on May 27.

title: India legend makes massive statement on Rohit, Virat Kohli retirement
content: Dilip Vengsarkar expressed surprise at Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Test retirements, expecting them after the England tour. He acknowledged their significant contribution and the void they leave. Vengsarkar highlighted the opportunity for domestic players to step up and praised Shreyas Iyer's consistent performance across formats, deferring to selectors on replacements.

title: NSA Doval to visit Russia next week: What is on agenda
content: NSA Ajit Doval is scheduled to visit Moscow to push for the swift delivery of remaining S-400 systems, potentially ordering more to enhance India's defence capabilities. This visit follows parliamentary delegation's trip and India's Operation Sindoor, which highlighted the effectiveness of Russian-origin defence platforms. India seeks deeper strategic coordination with Russia against terrorism and expects continued support.

title: JEE Main result declared for Paper 2: Download scorecards here
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has announced the JEE Main 2025 Paper 2 results for B.Arch and B.Planning on May 23 at jeemain.nta.nic.in. Candidates can access their scorecards using their registration number and date of birth. The scorecard contains subject-wise marks, overall NTA score, AIR, and personal details necessary for further admission processes.

title: 'Vaibhav Suryavanshi will play for India in 2 years'
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old batting prodigy, impressed in the IPL 2025 with Rajasthan Royals, scoring 252 runs in seven innings, including a blazing century. His coach, Ashok Kumar, believes that if Suryavanshi focuses on fitness and fielding, he could be fast-tracked into India's senior T20I team within two years. Ashok Kumar, who coached Suryavanshi at the Bihar U19 and senior men’s teams, believes the youngster has what it takes to be fast-tracked into the senior T20I setup within two years — provided he focuses on fitness and fielding.

title: How Jim Irsay prepared his daughters to succeed him as Colts owners
content: Jim Irsay grew up in privilege, with his father amassing a big enough fortune to acquire the Baltimore Colts in 1972 . but his involvement with the franchise did not originate in the boardroom . he often told stories about picking up players' jockstraps while cleaning the locker room .

title: Wrexham Women coach resigns after four seasons
content: manager Steve Dale announces his resignation from the Welsh club . he led the team to promotion to the top tier in Welsh football in 2023 . the team fell to a 3-1 defeat against Cardiff City in this year's final .

title: De Bruyne, Sané, Messi, Ronaldo among top free agents in 2025
content: the list of high-profile players whose contracts expire in 2025 is pretty impressive . there are some big names whose futures are not yet resolved . some are working on deals to find a new club behind the scenes . others have agreed their next move before they have even finished playing .

title: Liverpool's 'Miracle of Istanbul' through the eyes of Benitez, Garcia and the fans
content: Rafael Benitez's side sit 3-0 down to AC Milan in the UEFA champions league final . the imposing atatürk Olympic Stadium was not the most conventional setting for a miracle . it was a contest that Liverpool had no right to win .

title: Why the Colorado Rockies are every bookmaker's nightmare
content: the Colorado Rockies have the worst 50-game start in the majors since 1895 . a winning percentage puts them on pace to win only 26 games and lose 136 . bettors are fading the 2025 Rockies and avoiding backing them at all costs .

title: Can the NWSL withstand the allure of Europe?
content: the national women's soccer league is the most talent-rich, competitively balanced and exciting in the world . the league is stacked with many of the world's best players -- from the united states and Brazil, to Spain and France, to Malawi and Zambia . it's the English Premier League of women' s soccer -- the best of the global best .

title: How on earth can Arsenal stop Barcelona in Champions League final?
content: the 24th edition of the UEFA women's champions league awaits its final showdown in Lisbon on Saturday . the previous four meetings in the Champions League are split evenly (two wins for Arsenal in 2012; two wins for Barcelona in 2021) both teams have scored the exact same number of goals across these matches .

title: Mets, Dodgers prepare for high-stakes NL matchup
content: the defending world series champions play three games this weekend at Citi Field . the team they beat to win the national league pennant last fall play four games at Dodger Stadium starting June 2 . both teams enter back-and-forth battles for first place in their respective divisions .
